input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

output_blocks:
Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could potentially redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter wonderland, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year was marked by a gradual thaw, with temperatures inching up to a balmy 7°C. The sunny days brought a renewed sense of energy and motivation, both at work and at home. At the engineering lab, we delved deeper into the new projects, making steady progress towards our goals. I spent the week fine-tuning the design for the energy-efficient building project, collaborating with my colleagues to refine the details and explore potential applications. At home, the kids were in high spirits, their excitement for the new school year palpable. We spent the evenings helping them with their homework and discussing their day at school. The weekend brought a welcome break from the routine, with a family outing to the local botanical garden. The vibrant colors and fragrant blooms provided a much-needed respite from the winter blues. As we strolled through the gardens, we marveled at the resilience of nature and the beauty it brings to our lives.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year was a productive one, with temperatures hovering around 10°C. The mild weather allowed for a more focused work environment, both at the lab and at home. At the engineering lab, we made significant strides in the development of the energy-efficient building design. I spent the week collaborating with my team to finalize the design and prepare presentations for potential investors. At home, the kids were in the midst of their winter sports season, with hockey practices and basketball games keeping them busy. We spent the evenings helping them with their homework and discussing their progress in school. The weekend brought a much-needed break from the routine, with a family day trip to the nearby ski resort. The crisp mountain air and the invigorating winter sports provided a welcome change of pace.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
The fourth week of the year was a busy one, with temperatures dipping back down to a chilly 3°C. The cold weather didn't deter us from our work, however, as we continued to make progress on our projects. At the engineering lab, we presented our energy-efficient building design to potential investors, receiving positive feedback and encouragement. I spent the week following up on leads and preparing for the next phase of the project. At home, the kids were in the midst of their winter break, which provided an opportunity for some quality family time. We spent the evenings playing board games, watching movies, and cooking together. The weekend brought a quieter pace, with a day spent indoors, enjoying the warmth of our home and the company of our loved ones.

 Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
The fifth week of the year was a transitional one, with temperatures fluctuating between 5°C and 10°C. The unpredictable
